history.content:
Great question! Assuming this is purely at the employer's request and not necessary for an visa (if intl' student), it may be best to ask your employer that question. Is it an EE or CS focused internship?

Hello, EE/CS 97/197 is generally for international students needing CPT during the summer. In these cases, retroactive credit is not an option. It sounds like this might not be the case so please email me at lraya@eecs.berkeley.edu. Thanks!

Great question! Assuming this is purely at the employer's request and not necessary for an visa (if intl' student), it may be best to ask your employer that question. Is it an EE or CS focused internship?

children.subject: Is it possible to register for CS 197/97 in the fall semester and receive academic credit for a summer internship retroactively if a student wants the academic credit but doesn't want to pay the summer fees?
Yes, it is purely at my employer's request.  It is a CS focused internship.

history.content: I have an internship this summer, and my employer would like me to apply for academic credit.  I have not enrolled for the summer 2016 session via Tele-BEARS since the fees pose a financial burden.  Is it possible to register for CS 197/97 in the fall semester and receive academic credit for my summer internship retroactively?
history.subject: Summer Internship Credit in Fall 2016 Semester
